body_html:
Thank you @soumith I can understand the situation. Yes, it is essential for pytorch to utilise new instructions and provide more native features.
Good to see an active community and quick response times. Yes, you are right, i couldn't not get it to compile, though i tried, it went in circles, none of the tricks helped.
It becomes tricky with a single GPU vendor in the market and restricted cuda support. However, hopefully we will all join you back in few weeks, soon once we could upgrade to CUDA capability 5+ GPUs.

body:
Thank you @soumith  I can understand the situation. Yes, it is essential for pytorch  to utilise new instructions and provide more native features. 
Good to see an active community and quick response times. Yes, you are right, i couldn't not get it to compile, though i tried, it went in circles, none of the tricks helped. 
It becomes tricky with a single GPU vendor in the market and restricted cuda support. However, hopefully we will all join you back in few weeks, soon once we could upgrade to CUDA capability 5+ GPUs.
